days.title: Green Manufacturing Award & AMSA Hall of Fame
days.description: In recognition of the company that best demonstrates unparalleled performance in environmental manufacturing, Subaru of Indiana receives the Green Manufacturing Award from the American Manufacturing Strategy Awards and is inducted into the AMSA Hall of Fame.
days.shortdesc: Subaru of Indiana receives prestigious American Manufacturing Strategy Award.

days.title: Bloomberg Deems Subaru "America's Scrappiest Carmaker."
days.description:
"In its 22-year history - a period that has spanned three recessions, a global financial crisis, massive U.S. auto bankruptcies - SIA has rolled out more than 3 million vehicles and has never resorted to layoffs. Instead, it's given workers a wage increase every year of its operation."

Bloomberg Business features Subaru of Indiana and makes a compelling case why it might be the most exemplary car factory in America.
days.shortdesc: Bloomberg Business feature argues that Subaru of Indiana may be the most exemplary car factory in America.

days.title: Rain Gardens Unveiled
days.description: On October 13, 2011, Subaru becomes one of the first companies in NJ to invest in the local streams and waterways by installing two rain gardens at its corporate offices. Rain gardens, shallow depressions in lawns and fields that collect rainwater, act as natural filters allowing water to percolate down through layers of rock, gravel, or other drainage.
days.shortdesc: On October 13, 2011, Subaru becomes one of the first companies in NJ to invest in the local streams and waterways by installing two rain gardens at its corporate offices.
